alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 8:36PM MDT until April 22 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Saco affecting Phillips and Valley Counties. .The Milk River will slowly drop or remain steady over the next couple days. For the Milk River...including Saco and Nashua...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Saco. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water starts flooding the Bjornberg Bridge fishing access site on the north side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:16 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:16 PM MDT Tuesday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage Friday evening to 17.3 feet Monday morning and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 1130 AM MDT.
